title: Content Director
content:
**Must be able to work onsite in London office a few days/week**
We believe in Extraordinary. 
We are here to inspire the world to experience better. To show, not tell the world how things should be.  More inclusive. More accessible. More sustainable. And in doing so, to make our mark on marketing and create lasting change.  
At Jack Morton we create head-turning, stomach-dropping, mind-boggling, smile-inducing brand experiences for everyone. It’s the future of marketing and there’s nothing passive or predictable about it. We promise every day will be different than the previous one in a very good way. 
We take care of each other, as much as we take care of business. We marvel in each other’s uniqueness and revel in what each of us brings to the human potluck that is Jack - a culture that supports inclusivity, belonging, and individuality. We are 1Jack. United together in the relentless pursuit of the extraordinary.
We are driven to reimagine the future of brand experience. At the heart of this ambition is Jack X, our Innovation practice, operating at the intersection of Technology, Content and Data. The growth of this practice and increasing demand from clients has led to the exciting launch of X Studio, a next-gen production capability that creates engaging content driven and technology enabled experiences fuelled by AI and data. IRL and everywhere else.
So, if you want to help shape the future of an entire industry, welcome. We’re Jack, and we can’t wait to meet you.
Who are we looking for?Content Director
That brings us to you.
You are the inspiring, driving force behind our content strategy and production, establishing and growing a capability fuelled content creators, data and AI. You represent and positively reinforce the role of content to our clients through the quality of your thinking, presentation skills, relationship-building abilities, and passion for their brands/products and our business/vision/POV.
You are passionate about creating high-quality, beautifully crafted content that extends the impact and reach of brand experiences. You love to develop close relationships with your clients and thrive in the role of strategic partner and advisor. You have a strong sense of responsibility for ensuring client satisfaction and accountability for successful delivery of content programmes to clients.
You are a visionary storyteller, an exceptional leader, and a strategic thinker who can drive content strategy and creative to new heights. You also have a passion for staying ahead of content trends.
You are an organized team player who also loves to build strong relationships internally and has a passion for motivating and mentoring individuals.  You can problem solve and manage complex projects and situations in a team-based, fast paced environment.
You have a passion for content, technology and data. 
What you’ll be doing
Great Work

Provide visionary leadership to the content team, fostering a culture of creativity, innovation, and collaboration
Set the creative direction and maintain consistency in the quality and style of content across various platforms, channels and projects
Understand clients’ business and its challenges and serve as a trusted advisor to drive extraordinary content solutions
Develop and implement effective content strategies that align with client goals and resonate with their audience
Conceptualize and pitch content strategy and creative ideas to clients
Be a champion of extraordinary content work by providing inspiration, leadership, and expertise
Excel in presentations in front of the client and external partners and be seen as a credible voice on behalf of the agency
Drive internal and partner collaboration to achieve business success
Maintain clear and frequent communication with the client and internal teams to ensure alignment regarding roles, responsibilities, budgets, schedules, and status
Stay up-to-date with industry and content trends, emerging technologies, and creative best practices to keep our content fresh, relevant and ahead of the curve

If you can do all that, you have what it takes. It might help if…

You are a passionate, respectful, driven, and proven leader
You have 8+ years of relevant content creation experience
You have experience managing or mentoring junior level employees
You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment under tight deadlines
You can work effectively in a team environment with diverse perspectives
You are self-motivated with excellent problem-solving skills

Last, but not least, we believe in diversity, equity, and inclusion. 
Jack Morton and Genuine are equal opportunity employers; we strongly value diversity at our companies. We do not discriminate on race, religion, color, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by law. 
#LI-SC1We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.

demographic_questions.description:
Our Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. As such, we ask all applicants to provide the information listed below. You are NOT required to provide this information. To enable us to meet government reporting regulations, we request that you complete this personal data form. Information will be used for government reporting purposes and will be detached and kept separate from your application. Any information that you choose to provide will not be considered by the Company for employment purposes and will be treated as personal and confidential. Your voluntary cooperation will be appreciated.

Veteran Status

The following information is requested in order to fulfill statistical reporting and monitoring requirements. If you are a protected veteran, as noted below, you are asked to self-identify your US military veteran status. This information is voluntary and will be kept confidential as required under applicable federal and state law.

Definitions:

1. Disabled veteran - A veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or

- A person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.

2. Recently separated veteran — Any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service.

3. Armed Forces service medal veteran — A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

4. Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran — A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized, under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.
